class.name: Transform2D
class.description: Represents one or many transformations in 2D space such as translation, rotation, or scaling. It consists of a two [Vector2] x, y and [Vector2] "origin". It is similar to a 3x2 matrix.

method.name: Transform2D
method.description: Constructs the transform from 3 [Vector2]s representing x, y, and origin.

method.name: Transform2D
method.description: Constructs the transform from a given angle (in radians) and position.

method.name: affine_inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the matrix.

method.name: basis_xform
method.description: Transforms the given vector by this transform's basis (no translation).

method.name: basis_xform_inv
method.description: Inverse-transforms the given vector by this transform's basis (no translation).

method.name: interpolate_with
method.description: Returns a transform interpolated between this transform and another by a given weight (0-1).

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the transform, under the assumption that the transformation is composed of rotation and translation (no scaling, use affine_inverse for transforms with scaling).

method.name: orthonormalized
method.description: Returns the transform with the basis orthogonal (90 degrees), and normalized axis vectors.

method.name: rotated
method.description: Rotates the transform by the given angle (in radians).

method.name: scaled
method.description: Scales the transform by the given factor.

method.name: translated
method.description: Translates the transform by the given offset.

method.name: xform
method.description: Transforms the given [Vector2] or [Rect2] by this transform.

method.name: xform_inv
method.description: Inverse-transforms the given [Vector2] or [Rect2] by this transform.

members.member: The X axis of 2x2 basis matrix containing 2 [Vector2]s as its columns: X axis and Y axis. These vectors can be interpreted as the basis vectors of local coordinate system traveling with the object.
The Y axis of 2x2 basis matrix containing 2 [Vector2]s as its columns: X axis and Y axis. These vectors can be interpreted as the basis vectors of local coordinate system traveling with the object.
